title: Man seriously burnt after car explodes in Kelmscott police chase | 7NEWS
description: A man in his 30s sustained serious burns after a police pursuit in Kelmscott ended with his vehicle becoming bogged on Railway Avenue. Police allege the driver doused himself with accelerant before officers negotiated and arrested him, after which the vehicle exploded in flames that spread to the man. He was rushed to Fiona Stanley Hospital where he is in serious but stable condition, and a critical incident investigation has been launched. title: Craig Silvey books pulled amid child exploitation charges | 7NEWS
description: Australian author Craig Silvey has been charged with possessing and distributing child exploitation material, prompting major publishers Fremantle Press and Allen & Unwin to pause all promotional activity on his work. Bookstores including Dymocks have removed his books from shelves, whilst film screenings, theatre productions and school curriculum use of his texts have been suspended or cancelled across the country. Silvey was granted bail but remained in police custody after failing to meet his $100,000 surety. title: Tobacco wars escalate with Huntingdale arson attack | 7NEWS
description: A tobacco store in Huntingdale, Western Australia, was destroyed in a suspected arson attack at 3:15am, marking the latest incident in an escalating series of tobacco-related crimes across the state. The attack caused collateral damage to neighbouring businesses, cutting power and disrupting operations, while police investigate a potential link to a burnt-out car found 10 kilometres away in Forestdale. The incident has intensified calls for the WA government to recall parliament early and introduce tougher penalties similar to Victoria's laws, which allow fines exceeding $1.8 million compared to WA's current $80,000 maximum.
